name: HD 5583
scenarioDescription:
The HD 5583 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 5583 is a star with 1.01 times the mass of the Sun, and 9.09 times its radius. It is located 720.80 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7.41 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 5583 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 5583 system


HD 5583 b

HD 5583 b was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.53 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 5583 b is 1838.0400000000002 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 5583 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 5583, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Roque de los Muchachos Observatory.
